docs.snippet: WHEN 1939 ends next Sunday it will take sixth rank numerically in philatelic annals extending back  across nearly a century, and a review of the year discloses three outstanding features.

docs.snippet: COLON, Panama, Dec. 25--German Consul Walter Schmidt protested clearance of the Nazi freighter Duesseldorf in charge of a British prize crew, from Panama Canal waters today, but Major Gen. David L. Stone, United States Army commander in the Canal...
docs.lead_paragraph: COLON, Panama, Dec. 25--German Consul Walter Schmidt protested clearance of the Nazi freighter Duesseldorf in charge of a British prize crew, from Panama Canal waters today, but Major Gen. David L. Stone, United States Army commander in the Canal Zone, declared she was free to leave.
docs.abstract: arrives, Panama; German Consul W Schmidt protests clearance; U S Army comdr rules ship is free to leave; difficulties caused by illness of H von Appen, passenger, who demanded to be landed for operation; Capt P Peterson worried over his position
